docs.lead_paragraph: In an attempt to “crowd-source” a plan to reduce the federal budget deficit, FreedomWorks, a libertarian group, says it found broad support for repealing “Obamacare.”

headline.seo: FreedomWorks Deficit Survey Backs Repeal of ‘Obamacare’
headline.main: A Tea Party Panel Supports Health Care Law’s Repeal
headline.print_headline: A Tea Party Panel Supports Health Care Law’s Repeal

docs.abstract: Tea Party group FreedomWorks says its survey seeking public input on reducing federal deficit found broad support for repealing Pres Obama's health care legislation and eliminating entire federal departments, but much less enthusiasm for changes to Medicare and Social Security.
docs.snippet: In an attempt to “crowd-source” a plan to reduce the federal budget deficit, FreedomWorks, a libertarian group, says it found broad support for repealing “Obamacare.”

docs.lead_paragraph: After passing a landmark health bill, Massachusetts is now looking to become the first state to radically change the way health care providers are paid.

headline.seo: Massachusetts Looks at ‘Global Payments’ to Lower Health Cost
headline.main: Massachusetts Tries to Rein In Its Health Costs
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts Tries to Rein In Its Health Cost

docs.abstract: Massachusetts, having passed landmark health legislation in 2006, is looking to become the first state to radically change how health care providers are paid; Gov Deval Patrick and lawmakers are working toward plan that replaces fee-for-service system with one that would encourage flat 'global payments' to networks of providers for keeping patients well.
docs.snippet: After passing a landmark health bill, Massachusetts is now looking to become the first state to radically change the way health care providers are paid.

docs.lead_paragraph: A group of exchange students sponsored by the State Department spent thousands of dollars to experience life in the United States, but what they got were arduous shifts in a factory and no help when they complained.

headline.seo: Hershey Exchange Student Warnings Were Ignored
headline.main: Pleas Unheeded as Students’ U.S. Jobs Soured
headline.print_headline: Pleas Unheeded as Students’ U.S. Jobs Soured

docs.abstract: Events this summer at Hershey packing plant in Palmyra, Pa, reveal major holes in State Department's oversight of its summer work and travel program; they also expose serious lapses by Council for Educational Travel, USA, one of more than 70 sponsors contracted by the department to organize the students' trips to the United States and find jobs and housing for them.
docs.snippet: A group of exchange students sponsored by the State Department spent thousands of dollars to experience life in the United States, but what they got were arduous shifts in a factory and no help when they complained.

docs.lead_paragraph: New York’s second-largest union of state workers, the Public Employees Federation, struck a last-minute deal with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo that must still be approved by members.

headline.seo: Cuomo’s Deal With Public Employees Federation Halts Layoffs
headline.main: Union’s Deal With Cuomo May Prevent 3,500 Layoffs
headline.print_headline: Union’s Deal With Cuomo Could Save 3,500 Jobs

docs.abstract: Public Employees Federation, New York's second-largest union of state workers, strikes last-minute deal with Cuomo administration that must still be approved by members; union hopes to avoid thousands of imminent layoffs; revised contract runs for four years, includes three-year wage freeze and requires members to make higher contributions toward health insurance.
docs.snippet: New York’s second-largest union of state workers, the Public Employees Federation, struck a last-minute deal with Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo that must still be approved by members.
